topic.title: Just putting this out there for everyone
topic.body: If anyone needs somebody to talk to, feel free to message me on ZeroMail. No judgment. I check my mail at least once a day.

topic.title: Taking ZeroNet a step further
topic.body:
If adoption of ZeroNet ever seriously kicks off by the masses, I think it would be amazing if we could eliminate the internet connection all together.

Projects like Broadband-Hamnet use WiFi routers to connect amateur radio operators together, and I'm unable to find it now but I distinctly remember an Android app that used mesh WiFi and Bluetooth to create a twitter-like social network without an internet connection.

Of course, you'd have to be in range of another person running the app or someone with a modified router. But if you're using an app on your phone, it could run in the background and connect to another phone to synchronize content between them, that device will later see another device running ZeroNet and synchronize content, and so on.

This is just a dream of mine, we'd need many people to adopt ZeroNet for this to actually be viable. A few years ago I ran that app I mentioned non-stop for months as I traveled and not once did it find another device to connect to.

But maybe someday

1519018850_19WW28sn46rz9h15xf6NCELPdzxZ2.body: I know how you feel, whenever I see someone having issues with their computer it's always hard for me to keep my mouth shut and act dumb. Same thing with sending photos of documents. I have the paper right here, why won't you just take it and verify it yourself? You seriously want to give me the opportunity to modify it? People put too much trust into others. Your posts have seemed kinda gloomy lately. Feel free to mail me if you want an objective voice to talk to.

1519107162_19pJyuDtmDMaXxWCWB4bHdpna37x1.body:
> [styromaniac](#comment_182_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Are you thinking of FireChat?
It wasn't FireChat but very similar. This is a pretty cool app though! Thanks for telling me about it!

> [blazar](#comment_17_1P1baCe1LLjror4CZjChWFy7D7cVWyPL83): WiFi is too near field comminucation in global scale. You need either fido-like system or something like LoRaWAN but fast enough. It is essential to make communication at least in scale about 10-100km.
That's a good idea! Use something like that as a backbone AND use WiFi or something near field for "legacy" devices to synchronize with each other.

1519205469_1EjCZapTECBem63aaBazBrwa9eh9A.body: What browser are you using, and what version? Do you have an adblocker installed?

> [halex](#comment_28_1EjCZapTECBem63aaBazBrwa9eh9AwmXuq): I think it is a problem with Google Chrome. I can login OK with Firefox : (

Which version of Chrome?
Do you have an adblocker installed?
And as htgozn said, which ZeroWiki? Just copy-paste the link.

I need you to answer all of these in order to help you.

> [halex](#comment_30_1EjCZapTECBem63aaBazBrwa9eh9AwmXuq): Chrome version: Versi√≥n 64.0.3282.167 (Build oficial) (64 bits) [...]

I'm not able to replicate this with the same build of Chrome.
Do you have any other addons that may be manipulating the page in some way?
Most Chrome addons inject javascript into the page.

1519451220_1F9qtxgSgbkeJX7NT2BARwR8XCn1X.body: Be careful, if it happens again maybe you should talk to a doctor.

1535256861_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJV.body:
Open the sidebar by clicking and dragging the 0 in the top right to the left.
Scroll down to "Identity Address" and click "Change".
Click on "No Certificate".
You can do this to log out of any zite.
